data.name: XSlideShowController
desc: interface to control a running slide show.
**since**
OOo 3.0

methods.name: activate
desc: activates the user interface of this slide show.

methods.name: addSlideShowListener
desc: adds a listener that receives events while the slide show is running.

methods.name: blankScreen
desc: pauses the slide show and blanks the screen in the given color.
Change attribute Pause to false to unpause the slide show.

methods.name: deactivate
desc: can be called to deactivate the user interface of this slide show.
A deactivated

methods.name: getCurrentSlide
desc: returns slide that is currently displayed

methods.name: getCurrentSlideIndex
desc: returns the index of the current slide.

methods.name: getNextSlideIndex
desc: the index for the slide that is displayed next.

methods.name: getSlideByIndex
desc: gives access to the slides that will be shown in this slide show.

Slides are returned in the order they will be displayed in the presentation which can be different than the orders of slides in the document. Not all slides must be present and each slide can be used more than once.

methods.name: getSlideShow
desc: returns the actual XSlideShow instance that runs the slide show.
Normally all navigation should be done using this controller and not the XSlideShow itself.

methods.name: gotoBookmark
desc: goto the given textual bookmark

methods.name: gotoFirstSlide
desc: goto and display first slide

methods.name: gotoLastSlide
desc: goto and display last slide.
Remaining effects on the current slide will be skipped.

methods.name: gotoNextEffect
desc: start next effects that wait on a generic trigger.
If no generic triggers are waiting the next slide will be displayed.

methods.name: gotoNextSlide
desc: goto and display next slide.
Remaining effects on the current slide will be skipped.

methods.name: gotoPreviousEffect
desc: undo the last effects that were triggered by a generic trigger.
If there is no previous effect that can be undone then the previous slide will be displayed.

methods.name: gotoPreviousSlide
desc: goto and display previous slide.
Remaining effects on the current slide will be skipped.

methods.name: gotoSlide
desc: jumps to the given slide.
The slide can also be a slide that would normally not be shown during the current slide show.

methods.name: gotoSlideIndex
desc: jumps to the slide at the given index.

methods.name: isActive
desc: determines if the slide show is active.

methods.name: isEndless
desc: returns TRUE if the slide show was started to run endlessly.

methods.name: isFullScreen
desc: Returns TRUE if the slide show was started in full-screen mode.

methods.name: isPaused
desc: returns TRUE if the slide show is currently paused.

methods.name: isRunning
desc: returns true if the slide show is still running.
If this returns false, this component is already disposed. You can start a new slide show and get a new instance of XSlideShowController from XPresentation2

methods.name: pause
desc: pauses the slide show.
All effects are paused.
The slide show continues on next user input or if resume() is called.

methods.name: removeSlideShowListener
desc: removes a listener.

methods.name: resume
desc: resumes a paused slide show.

methods.name: setEraseAllInk
desc: This method clears ink drawing from the slideshow being played.
**since**
LibreOffice 7.2

methods.name: stopSound
desc: stop all currently played sounds

properties.name: AlwaysOnTop
desc: If this attribute is set to TRUE, the window of the slide show is always on top of all other windows.

properties.name: MouseVisible
desc: If this attribute is TRUE, the mouse is visible during the slide show.

properties.name: PenColor
desc: This attribute changes the color of the pen.

properties.name: PenWidth
desc: This attribute changes the width of the pen.
**since**
LibreOffice 4.2

properties.name: UsePen
desc: If this is TRUE, a pen is shown during presentation.
You can draw on the presentation with this pen.
